creator: is87062@cis.nctu.edu.tw
text:
There are some porblems with the implementation of jmx component when using 
jmx 1.2.
For example, the line 87 of org.apache.log4j.jmx.LoggerDynamicMBean,
the first parameter of the construtor of "MBeanParameterInfo"
is not a valid "Java identifier". The name "Class Name" should be changed 
to "className". We can find these problems throughout this component.

creator: seth@ehawaii.gov
text:
I too experience this using JMX 1.2.  It would be great if log4j was updated to
JMX 1.2.

creator: seth@ehawaii.gov
text:
I have just made the modifications to get log4j to start up and work in a JMX
1.2 environment (tested with latest version of mx4j).

I can produce a patch if anyone is interested.

Yeah, I'm interested -- please attach the patch(es) (in diff -u format as 
always) to this bug report.  Thank you.
creator: yoavs@computer.org
ndeloof@capgemini.fr
text:
Sorry, I just discovered this bug was allready commited

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 38236 ***
Sorry, I didn't closed the correct issue to mark duplicated...
creator: ndeloof@capgemini.fr

text: *** Bug 38236 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: ndeloof@capgemini.fr
genman@noderunner.net
text:
This was fixed in JMX 1.2.1 as an errata
http://archives.java.sun.com/cgi-bin/wa?A2=ind0310&L=jmx-forum&P=1670

As JDK 1.2.1 is quite old, probably this is not an issue.  However, fixing the
problem names is not that hard, so I'll go ahead and fix them for 1.3 (SVN trunk.)

creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
Changes committed in logging/log4j/trunk by eross in rev 500382.

However, I'm guessing those changes would make a breaking functional change between log4j 1.3 and 
log4j 1.2 and probably worth additional investigation.

creator: thorbjoern@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #9)

> However, I'm guessing those changes would make a breaking functional change between log4j 1.3 and 
> log4j 1.2 and probably worth additional investigation.

As log4j 1.3 has been discontinued isn't this additional investigation superfluous, hence this issue can be closed?

creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
This bug affects log4j 1.2, but there is likely no way to "fix" it without potentially breaking users who depend on the existing behavior.  Marking it as WONTFIX is probably appropriate.  

The JMX code was added without any discussion and there is no community around it.  However, since it has been in releases it can't be changed in ways that might break any hypothetical users.  With reported issues, if anything occurs with JMX it will likely be something brand new with a different package name.
